result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory A Curtis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay  DNA surcharge, all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  To be taken by DOC from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balances remaining to be paid on Extended Supervision on  regular monthly payments until paid in full.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant or tax intercept.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment. Be given job and vocational training.

No alcohol.  No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No association with known drug users or drug dealers.  No contact with any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Cognitive behavioral therapy/criminal thinking programming if not already completed while in prison.
AODA assessment, treatment.  Random drug testing. Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, unless previously provided.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory A Curtis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment 973.195 is DENIED by the Court, because it is not in the public interest.  Order received, signed, and filed with the court.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, for review. jbs
DENYING request for sentence credit.  Order signed and filed.  Copy sent to parties.  aw
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, the defendant's request for sentence credit filed 6/23/15 is hereby assigned to the Hon. Clare L. Fiorenza, Br. 3, for review. mag
Revocation Order and Warrant for case 14CF1621 dated 3/13/15.
Defendant's pro se motion to modify sentence seeking sentence credit.
/(2) in support of defendant, received and filed.

Defendant Gregory A Curtis in court with attorney John c Glover.  Defendant Gregory A Curtis in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case passed to the afternoon for sentencing.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney John c Glover in court, defendant Gregory A Curtis not in court, in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Court is in trial.  Negotiations ongoing.  Defense has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 5/21/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John c Glover in court, defendant Gregory A Curtis not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Another scheduling conference requested.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gregory A Curtis in court with attorney John c Glover.  Defendant Gregory A Curtis in custody.  Kevin Shomin for Ron Dague for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Gregory A Curtis in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  
Defendant Gregory A Curtis in custody.  
Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
